Cognate with English {{m|nl|when|}}, German {{m|de|wann}}. ====Adverb==== {{nl-adv}} # {{lb|nl|archaic}} [[when]] #: ''En ik dacht aan den geur harer bloesems, aan het huiveren harer takken, aan den zang harer vogelen; en ik vroeg mij: '''wen''' rieken wij die?'' (V. Someren, 1822) #:: And I thought about the scent of her blossoms, at the shuddering of her branches, at the songs of her birds, and I asked myself: '''when''' do we smell these? ====Conjunction==== {{head|nl|conjunction}} # {{lb|nl|archaic}} [[when]] #: ''Daar heb ik '''wen''' de vogels vlogen, heimelik in elk nest geschouwd!'' (L. De Mont, 1880) #:: There have I, '''when''' the birds flew, looked privily in each nest! ===Etymology 2=== ====Verb==== {{head|nl|verb form}} # {{nl-verb form of|p=1|n=sg|t=pres|m=ind|wennen}} # {{nl-verb form of|m=imp|wennen}} [[Category:Dutch interrogative adverbs]] ---- ==Elfdalian== ===Etymology=== {{rfe|ovd}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|ovd|pronoun|cat2=interrogative pronouns}} # [[what]] ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[veËn]}} * {{rhymes|de|eËn}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun form}} # {{lb|de|interrogative}} {{inflection of|de|wer||acc}}: [[whom]] {{qualifier|direct object}}. #: '''''Wen''' hast du gefragt?'' #:: '''Whom''' did you ask? ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German interrogative pronouns]] ---- ==Gothic== ===Romanization=== {{got-rom|head=wÄ“n}} # {{romanization of|got|ğ…ğŒ´ğŒ½}} ---- ==Japanese== ===Romanization=== {{ja-romaji}} # {{ja-romanization of|ã‚‘ã‚“}} ---- ==Mandarin== ===Romanization=== {{head|cmn|pinyin}} # {{nonstandard spelling of|cmn|sc=Latn|wÄ“n}} # {{nonstandard spelling of|cmn|sc=Latn|wÃ©n}} # {{nonstandard spelling of|cmn|sc=Latn|wÄ›n}} # {{nonstandard spelling of|cmn|sc=Latn|wÃ¨n}} ====Usage notes==== * {{cmn-toneless-note}} ---- ==Middle English== ===Noun=== {{head|enm|noun}} # {{alt form|enm|wayn|id=wagon|t=wagon}} ---- ==Old English== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|ang|Æ¿Ä“n}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|ang|gem-pro|*wÄ“niz}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|ang}} {{m|ine-pro|*wen-||love}}.
